resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

rdettai commented on pull request #8697:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8697#issuecomment-732125285


   @alamb @Dandandan Upgrading Tokio to 0.3 is not as simple as it seams. The runtime is not compatible with the 0.2 one, and it requires to add a compatibility adapter that runs an extra thread (https://docs.rs/tokio-compat-02/0.1.2/tokio_compat_02/). 
   
   The problem is that many libraries are still running 0.2 (as 0.3 is fairly recent):
   - tonic: flight is mostly broken because of that
   - rustoto: not directly used but used by external users (and not just me I guess 😄)
   
   What was the reason for upgrading Tokio? If there is no clear reason, I would be in favor of downgrading back to 0.2.


----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8697#issuecomment-732125285


   @alamb @Dandandan Upgrading Tokio to 0.3 is not as simple as it seems. The runtime is not compatible with the 0.2 one, and it requires to add a compatibility adapter that runs an extra thread (https://docs.rs/tokio-compat-02/0.1.2/tokio_compat_02/). 
   
   The problem is that many libraries are still running 0.2 (as 0.3 is fairly recent):
   - tonic: flight is mostly broken because of that
   - rustoto: not directly used but used by external users (and not just me I guess 😄)
   
   What was the reason for upgrading Tokio? If there is no clear reason, I would be in favor of downgrading back to 0.2.

Dandandan commented on pull request #8697:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8697#issuecomment-732184350


   @rdettai 
   The reason was more to upgrade to the latest version to benefit from the changes and to make future upgrades easier (tokio 1.0 is also coming).
   
   For me it would be no problem to downgrade to tokio 0.2 if it causes too much problems elsewhere and wait until other libraries catch up.

alamb commented on pull request #8697:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8697#issuecomment-732441804


   @rdettai  -- I am also fine downgrading back to tokio 3.0 -- I read some of the discussion on https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8734 and it seems like arrow flight is ok? 
   
   Can you be clearer about what exactly is breaking for you? Is it downstream dependencies that can't be to get updated to tokio 3.0?

   Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but if I run:
   `cd rust/arrow-flight; cargo run --example server`
   on the current master, the server panics. Is it working for you?
   
    I can try to make the example into a test to have this verified automatically, but I wont have time to do it before the end of the week.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description: Upgrades versions to latest one. Brings in tokio 0.3, crossbeam 0.8 and some smaller updates.

comments.body: I am not able to assign this ticket to [~Dandandan] -- but he did the work. Thank you!
